result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Anthony Sessum

records.addlTxt:
10:21 AM Defendant Chad Anthony Sessum not in court.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests warrant and bail forfeited.
Court orders warrant and bail forfeited, Douglas adjoining counties and Ashland
Signed Order to Seal Identification Key
No contact with victim 1 or their residence, no violent or abusive contact with victim 2, must update address wtihin 24 hours upon release from jail.

01:30 PM Defendant Chad Anthony Sessum in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Chad Anthony Sessum in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.  States request on bail: $1000 cash bail with conditions of no contact with victims 1 and 2 or address listed in the ID Key. State gives prior criminal history out of California and absconding from California. State asserts that there is a request for defendant not to return to the address listed on the complaint. Defendant indicates he will stay at the Solid Rock house or the Ruth House.
Atty Hoffman understands that Defendant is currently living here in Superior. Defendant does have two jobs. Atty does not know if there is a warrant out of California. Defendant does have approximately have $250 on his credit card. 
Court does believe cash is warranted. Defendant doesn't really have an address at this time. Court is concerned about the allegations and recently moving to Superior.  Court hears from victim 2. Court orders $1000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or their residence. Court does give contact with victim 2 as long as it's not violent or abusive. Defendant must update his address within 24 hours of release from jail. 
Atty Hoffman indicates defendant does not qualify.  Status conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
